inference:
The stamps issued before the $70\text{'s}$ are in the decades $50\text{'s}$ and $60\text{'s}$. The total number of stamps is $4+8=12$. Each stamp costs $6$ cents for the $50\text{'s}$ and $7$ cents for the $60\text{'s}$. So, the total cost is $(12\times6)+(12\times7)=72+84=156$ cents.
Final Answer: $\boxed{1.56}$. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: His South American stamps issued before the $70\text{'s}$ include $4+7=11$ from Brazil that cost $11 \times \$ 0.06 = \$ 0.66$ and $6+4=10$ from Peru that cost $10 \times \$0.04 = \$0.40.$ Their total cost is $ \$ 0.66 + \$ 0.40 = \boxed{\$ 1.06}.$

ground_truth: His South American stamps issued before the $70\text{'s}$ include $4+7=11$ from Brazil that cost $11 \times \$ 0.06 = \$ 0.66$ and $6+4=10$ from Peru that cost $10 \times \$0.04 = \$0.40.$ Their total cost is $ \$ 0.66 + \$ 0.40 = \boxed{\$ 1.06}.$
